description.narrative: The Goal of the Capfish/FOSTER project is to improve the socio-economic conditions of the fishing communities and environmental sustainability of the (Western) Tonle Sap Biosphere Reserve (TSBR) through community-centered interventions reaching over 200000 women, men and children in Cambodia. The Capfish/FOSTER Project led by Oxfam and 14 partners has 3 Objectives: 1)Fishing communities in the Tonle Sap have increased access to safe water supply, hygiene and sanitation services2) Vulnerable and poor girls and boys are provided with increased availability and accessibility to education and can successfully transition through school 3) Fishing communities in the Tonle Sap have developed sustainable alternative livelihoods. The project contributes to outcome 3 (green economy component) of the EU-CAPFISH program. The Pavilion will conduct a series of studies including: - costs relating to the conduct of an inventory study to complement findings acquired by FACT that will be conducted by a consultant (for a total of 3 timesin only Y1 of the project) who will be accompanied by a project staff to provide translation. - costs relating to the conduct of a 10-day market/trendsstudy (mainly desk-based). - Costs relating to the launch of the professional hospitality skill development training and actual training to be delivered by professional trainers. - Costs relating to the development of an investment roadmap, led by a consultant who will collaborate with local communities to produce deliverables including investment memos, business plans and process guidelines.

participating-org.narrative:
MAADS is a hospitality development and management initiative. It was set-up by a team of passionate and creative professionals who founded and operate a collection of boutique hotels, restaurants and travel experiences throughout Cambodia. PAVILION is aboutique hotel with three dozen rooms, steps away from the Royal Palace and across Wat Botum Royal Pagoda. MAADS/PAVILION has 16 years of experience in hospitality.
- Goal, Vision, mission and value Our Goal: To create places and experience that are firmly rooted into ourdestination’s character. Our Vision: To be Cambodia’s leading boutique hospitality collection – to the benefit of us as a team, of our guests, our partners and the great destinations hosting us. Our Mission: To develop memorablehospitality experiences in Cambodia’s most exciting sites. To give each its own strong personality and a deep connection to local creativity, in natural harmony with their environment. To make our partners proud participants, while growing our teams’ competences, careers and well-being. Our Value:Humanity: Teamwork, Diversity, Acceptance, Sensitivity. Simplicity: Elegance, Clarity, Design. Creativity: Imagination, Passion, Persistence, Experience, Excitement, Originality, Out-of-the-Box. Environment: Nature, Culture, Conservation, Responsibility, Community, Respect.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
